Text: Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain. Unless the LORD watches over the city, the watchman stays alert in vain.
Context: This verse emphasizes the futility of human efforts without divine blessing. It metaphorically compares the building of a house and guarding a city to any human endeavor.

Text: In vain you rise early and stay up late, toiling for food to eat—for He grants sleep to those He loves.
Context: Expresses the pointlessness of anxious labor and the value of rest, illustrating that provision and rest come from God.

Text: Children are a heritage from the LORD, offspring a reward from Him.
Context: This verse shifts to express the blessing and value of children, indicating a positive view of family as bestowed by God.

Text: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, so are children born in one’s youth.
Context: Emphasizes the strength and potential that children bring to their parents, comparing them to a warrior‘s arrows.

Text: Blessed is the man whose quiver is full of them. They will not be put to shame when they contend with their opponents in court.
Context: Ends on a positive note about the blessings of having a family; suggests security and honor in society.
